text:
This would be especially useful when using CONCAT to write text files to disk. 
There is currently no way to insert property values into the text -- eg.
<concat dir="something>I would like to insert the value ${property1} into the 
message
</concat> and have ant substitute the real value for the ${property1} tag in 
the resultant file.

I am not to certain what is request. Note that in ant1.6.0, the
concat task allows a nested filterchain element that can expand
properties - this may address this enhancement request.
    <property name="my.property" value="This is set"/>
    <concat>${my.property}</concat>
    <concat destfile="x.p">$${my.property}</concat>
    <concat><path path="x.p"/></concat>
    <concat>
      <path path="x.p"/>
      <filterchain>
        <expandproperties/>
      </filterchain>
    </concat>

This outputs:
   [concat] This is set


   [concat] ${my.property}


   [concat] This is set
